Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic red-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a stamnos; interior: upper part reserved, glazed black below; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of youth to right wearing chlamys; part of added red hat strap tied under chin showing he had a petasos on his head, possibly a rider; relief contour and preliminary sketch.
Producer name: Related to: The Eucharides Painter (possibly (D. Williams))
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 519, no. C101)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0278) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 120, pl. LXVI, no. 6)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
